metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25662 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description: A Red Hat only CVE-2020-12352 regression issue was found in the way the Linux kernel's Bluetooth stack implementation handled the initialization of stack memory when handling certain AMP packets. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to leak small portions of stack memory on the system by sending specially crafted AMP packets. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

criterions.comment: linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
